The 11 traditional leaders who rule the people are: YaChungu, Bunge, Kusizi, Sikalu, Chaka, Nyambe, Nyanjimu, Luthuli, Limpopo, Chief Mangeni, and Chief Mkala. 
 
Chief Mangeni is a hero, while Chief Mkala is a tyrant. Chief Chaka is a villain. 

The leaders of the time referred to as Bunke are Chaka, Nyambe, Nyanjimu, and Luthuli.

Ekhobaza elihubaza
Nelson M. Zunguro es la nueva versión del software EIWA, un sistema operativo creado en 1997 y que se ha utilizado durante los últimos 20 años en los colegios de la Comunidad Indígena de Namibia, y que ahora ofrece un sistema basado en Linux.

La comunidad nativa se enfrentaba al dilema de disponer actualmente de una infraestructura virtualizada, que requería software de gestión de la información confidencial y accesible, pero que no estaba actualizada. Al mismo tiempo que se continuaba con la implementación del software existente, las autoridades de la Comunidad Indígena necesitaban contar con herramientas de software que mejoraran el procesamiento, almacenamiento y acceso tanto a la información y la comunicación, como a sistemas de control y gestión, sin la necesidad de reinventar constantemente herramientas informáticas.
 
Ilihubu
La elección de utilizar Linux como nueva versión del software EIWA, fue el camino menos transitado y permitió reducir los costos de implementación; a la vez que los participantes del proyecto se adaptaron fácilmente al cambio y se adaptaron a las nuevas tecnologías.

Desde su creación en 1997

Lets Talk is South Africa's leading community of support and advice for young people as they navigate relationships, career paths, education and the journey to adulthood. The platform uses the "No One Will Listen To Us" campaign slogan to offer anonymity, privacy and a safe environment for young people to share their life stories, ask questions, seek advice and find new information on a range of areas that concern them. It offers the following services:

No One Will Listen To Us (Role-model videos/talks)
Advice for Careers & Education
Find Local Support Groups

### Q: Can you explain how No One Will Listen To Us initiative is different from other online communities? 
A: No One Will Listen To Us is the first and only platform that offers anonymity, privacy and a safe space for young people, as well as provide advice on how to navigate the complexities of relationships, careers, education and the journey to adulthood. Other online platforms are not designed for young people. They are designed to assist adults in various aspects of life, and may not meet the specific needs and challenges of young people.

Children and young people aged 5 to 18 

1. Keep your computer and other digital devices safe by using strong passwords, not clicking on suspicious links, and reporting concerns.

4. Be careful about giving out personal information online, including your address, phone number, and school name.
